key_risks: Regulatory and legal risks due to environmental and safety violations
Economic sensitivity tied to cyclical industries like oil and gas
Competitive pressures in the environmental services industry
controversies: Fines for hazardous waste violations, including a $270,412 penalty in Kimball, Nebraska
Criticism for shipping PFAS-laden firefighting foam to low-income communities for incineration
environmental_issues: Reliance on incineration and landfill disposal methods
Environmental violations, such as the $581,236 penalty in 2014 for hazardous waste violations
social_issues: Environmental justice concerns related to waste disposal practices in low-income communities
governance_issues: Ongoing compliance challenges with environmental and safety regulations

sources.title: U.S. EPA fines Clean Harbors treatment facility over hazardous waste ...
sources.snippet: SAN FRANCISCO (Oct. 20, 2021) -The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) reached a settlement with hazardous waste treatment company Clean Harbors for improper management of hazardous waste at its facility in San Jose, California. Improper storage and management of hazardous wastes poses threats to human health or the environment. The company has agreed to pay a $25,000 civil penalty.
